I'll take dirty kitchen any day.
author: Alyson C.

description:
I love their jook (rice porridge) It has the most flavor. I usually get the preserved duck egg with pork for $3.50.

Now they have these deals where if you sit in and eat, you can get won-ton noodle soup or just won ton soup or chicken porridge for $1.95! 

It may seem a little dingy, but the service is good and the food is excellant.
author: Janelle H.

description:
My BF orders take out from here during his lunch and usually brings me home the left overs. I know, i'm like his garbage disposal, though it should be the other way around haha... it's all out of love I tell you.

$5.00 for an entire box of chowmein or mongolian beef over rice or whatever the heck you decide to order...are you kidding me?? The food here is definitely worth the price- you seriously cannot beat that!
author: M W.

description:
Spicy salted squid.

Mmmmmmmm.

SPICY SALTED SQUID.

MMMMMMMMMMMMMM!

When I go home, this dish is near the top of my "must have" list. I just plain love it -- from the garlicky green peppery "junk" that lingers on my rice long after the squid has disappeared into my piehole to the firm yet tender squid that is steaming hot as it arrives at my table.

The atmosphere at this restaurant is really just non-existent. The click-clacking of the little electronic good luck figurine of an old man fanning himself is borderline annoying. No matter, though, because you're really just there to chow down on inexpensive homestyle Cantonese-style cooking.

This restaurant earns itself an extra star for its amazingly affordable take out trays of chow mein, chow fun, etc. At $2 per pound (with a minimum of 5 pounds), the price means you do NOT need to trek down to Chinatown to load up for any parties.
author: Audrey J.

description:
I would of given Menkee 5-stars if they didnt paint their kitchen windows! I used to look forward to watching the chefs cook my order with their huge woks and long spoons. it made me feel like i was in the kitchen.

but as all good things come to an end, they finally got fed up with people staring at them and decided to paint the windows an orange redish color?

my favorite dish is the "egg and prawns over chowfun noodles"... so good.
author: Dave N.

description: This place is pretty dirty and jank but I tell you they have some good grub.  You must must must get the salt and pepper fried fishies...they are sooo addicting.  Also the sauteed liver with green onions and ginger are good too.  Just make sure its not over cooked or it will be dry.  The next dish I recommend is for a brave eater...the fried larger intestine.  It is soo crunchy and good but it is a bit gamey so fair warning.  I suggest to also get the pork blood congee to cleanse some of the other oily dishes.  Most of the good dishes are listed in Chinese unfortunately but I still love this place even though its a dirty hole-in-the-wall.
author: Jody C.

description: Worst customer service...ever.  The waitress never acknowledged my friends and I when we walked into the restaurant so we sat ourselves (most of the restaurant was empty).  We waited for about 20 minutes but she never came by to take our order.  After realizing that the waitress could care less about her customers (and we were really hungry), I walked directly to her and informed her that we were ready to order.  She hardly glanced at me as I spoke.  We waited another 15 minutes before we walked out.  As I was on my way out, I turned back and said, "You are a terrible waitress!" and without looking at me, she responded, "Yeah, ok...ok."  Wow.  Needless to say, I will not return.  I was extremely disgusted with the bathroom/restaurant and service.  The silver lining of this experience? The waitress' terrible service or lack thereof probably saved my friends and I from getting food poisoning.
author: My N.

description: This place have the Best chinese FOOD in SUNSET. Honestly This place might not look good on the outside, but the Inside is the suprise!! Price = Good, Food = Good. what more can you ask for? remember this is not a 5 star resturant. but it is family owned. So when i eat their food i always think about food i be eating at home. brings back the family taste!
author: Johnson C.

description:
Never ate in and never will. I do have SOME standards.

However, under $5.00 for a take out?? Now that's for reals. This is SF, people, where most valets cost more than that.

Therefore, for the price... any time, my friend, any time.
author: Stanley L.

description:
This place specializes in chiu-chow style cooking. We usually order some small dishes such as the salt-n-pepper, small, white fish and the stuffed combo (egglplant, tofu, bell pepper) and have that with plain porridge. I personally, prefer the regular, Cantonese style porridge. The chiu-chow style porridge is just cooked rice served in hot water.

Overall, the prices are rock bottom for tasty chinese food so try to overlook the whole-in-the-wall decor.
author: Cuisine N.

description: When i'm lazy i usually come here for my take out orders, fuken fried rice is good one of the menu items i order all the time..The place is usually empty the the take out orders are stacked up high, the $$ for the value is great... and the portion size is good for me,but since i come pretty often they usually hook me up
author: jonathan h.

description: Cheap eats. Great food. I really like their mongolian beef over rice. Takeout and 10% off. Reason for only three stars? DIRTY. DIRTY. DIRTY.
author: Katherine C.

description:
the restaurant doesnt look that clean but i love the fact i can sit and watch the cooks prepare my take out in front of me. i wouldnt eat here but take out is good especially since they have 10% off ALL take outs.

i agree with everyone's review -- their wonton is really good.
author: Carol Y.

description: Simple, affordable and tasty neighborhood Chinese restaurant. Their congee (rice porridge) and their chow fun are both very good and compares favorably to other Chinese restaurants.
author: Steve L.

description:
Really good value place!  Very comfortable down home spot to grab a meal.  Not the cleanest dining room in the world but you could always do take out cause they have had that 10% off on take out orders pretty much since they first opened.  

Many things on their menu appeal to me.  If I lived closer to here, I would certainly be here much more often...
author: Mark W.

description: So in my quest to try all the won-ton joints in my neighborhood, I tried Menkee Wonton.  The menu has some unique items, but most I couldn't try because they contained meat.  So what did I end up ordering?  The plain congee.  It was good, and only $1.75 for a huge bowl.  I just wish that I didn't have to ask for green onions, and I wish that they had Chinese donuts on their menu.  If I do ever want Menkee's congee again, I'll order for pick up.
author: Sandy K.

description:
For the past month or so, I have been here at least 3 times, after i found this place on yelp.  I was craving Wontons and had no clue where they made good wontons...took my chances and came here.

At first when we arrived i thought it was weird that i had never noticed it.  Decided eh WTF....lets try it.

This place is called Wonton for a reason ppl....other than the wontons, none of their other dishes really appealed to me.  The beef stew wonton would have been tastier if there weren't so much fat in the BEEF!  if i could at least have some beef.  Eh no complaints...its cheap...what can i say.  I really like their Wontons, it taste sort of like home made wontons that mom or dad would make....i just didn't like the fact that they lacked variety in noodles...it was either wonton noodles or the ho fun.....bleh i favor neither ....

Definitely worth every penny for Wontons....Oh, the BF ordered the fried rice one time and it was really nothing special at all....again...i must stress, this is probably a hot spot for WOntons only.!
author: Shirley H.

description: Speaking purely from a noodle/chow fun take out perspective.....the portions have gotten smaller and smaller.  Flavor is fine.  Food was not greasy.
author: Debbie T.

description:
when im sick i come here and buy jook. its cheap. but i used to get food here. the chicken curry which wasnt very good but it was cheap. i used to think i would get more chicken if i said no onions but nope, theyll just add in more bell peppers. haha.
its pretty dirty in here but its cheap, so thats what you get.
author: just k.

description:
When you go to one of these places, you don't really expect superb customer service.. but this place is a joke. We had to buy frozen dumplings to cook at home. When we walked in, we were greeted by an angry Chinese woman with bright red injured blood-crusted nose (cringed at the sight. What the heck was that??). She realized we didn't speak Chinese, and pulled her middle-school-aged daughter from the back to translate. I guess this daughter is at the peak of her rebellious stage, because she was yelling at her mom about how she didn't want to help and rolling her eyes as she came out. 

So we tell this also angry girl what we want (frozen, UNCOOKED dumplings), and she just yelled something to her mom in Chinese without making any eye contact with us. The next moment, we see the kitchen guy throw 6 orders worth of dumplings in the pot!! I tried to tell them "No no no..!" but by then the lazy little girl with the devilish attitude has walked away. When we try to tell the woman, she waved her hand at our faces as though she was annoyed that we were trying to talk to her when she didn't understand English. Outraged, I tried to walk out of the restaurant. Then the guy from the kitchen came out ask us what the problem was. He barely spoke English too, but was kind enough to listen, and gave us what we wanted. No hassle. He was actually happy to hear that he didn't need to cook anything.

Afterwards we tried to pay, and the angry woman with the bloody red nose snatched our bills and threw down the change on the sticky, oil-slicked table. 

The dumplings were pretty good but the woman that works there probably brainstorms every night on how rude she can be to the customers. I don't ever want want to go back there to see her or her disturbed daughter.
author: Laura O.

description:
This was the first place I dined at after moving into the Sunset, and it's the essence of "nothing to write home about."

The food's cheap, portion sizes are respectable, and there is flavor, but those are about all the nice things I can say. 

The quality of the food is questionable at best and the last three times I ordered take-out, my order was botched by communication disconnects. Haven't eaten there in months and don't plan on changing that anytime soon.
author: Ash A.

description: Dirt cheap and good.  Especially for noodle dishes.  Not a place to linger and sit - get it to go!
author: Melinda C.

description:
Menkee is very inexpensive.  The food is tasty and the salt content is low. 

I usually order take out food and soup to go.  The daily soup reminds me of my childhood.  Heart-warming broth.  The daily soup is made fresh with meat, vegetables, and dried bok choy.    Yummy.  I grew up on soup.   


My list of favorites:

Mixed Vegetables w/ Beef or Chicken Over Rice
Minced Beef Over Rice
BBQ Pork Wonton Noodles w/ vegetables
Dried Beef Chow Fun
Tomato Chicken Chow Mein
Singapore Rice Noodles

I recommend Menkee for an inexpensive lunch and/or dinner.
author: Ann O.

description: Walked into Menkee Wonton to place a take out order earlier today. Waited for about 15 minutes and was just ignored by a very disturbed and aloof teenage waitress. When she walked by I asked her if I could place an order. She ignored me and nearly knocked me over. Not needing that type of attitude I decided to leave. Very odd way of running a business.
author: G N.

description: I don't even want to give them a star but it's required by Yelp. I know this is not the place to go for superb service but I didn't expect to get kicked out asking for hot sauce. The pathetic waitress kicked me out when I asked for hot sauce to compliment my fried rice. She simply said, "no, leave"! I was floored by her attitude and statement, I just left. Really, what do you say to that? I'm a business owner and I just don't understand how can one treat a customer that way. Well, I won't be giving them my business again even though they are in my neighborhood.
author: Tina S.

description: No frills mediocre hole-in-the-wall chinese food. Relatively cheap. Alright. Can't say more until I try it out a few more times.
author: Dijon Y.

description:
I would go here quite often a couple of years ago.
Of the sunset "wonton" spots I patronize, this one is number 3 on my list in this order...
Just Wonton
Wonton House
Menkee
I usually order either chow fun or Singapore chow mein here.
Here's a cool, funny, or useful story I have for this place....
So, one day I'm chillin at one of my boys' houses watchin a game, and we decide to get takeout from Menkee.
We order whatever we ordered, but my boy also orders the "deep fried pig bowels".  Basically pig intestines deep fried, sliced, and served with a sweet/sour sauce.  Now, I've eaten intestines before.  Beef intestines, pig intestines,,, 
Entrails are yummy.... usually.  
I'm used to intestines being sliced lengthwise, scrubbed, scrubbed, scrubbed, scrubbed, then scrubbed some more before cooking. 
These were sliced cross-wise.  Hmmmm..  
The aroma of dookie is sometimes present...WHAT?  Yup, its INTESTINES, remember?
So here's the good part.  I eat one... okay.  On the second one....I feel this round thing pop out of the piece of intestine...
HMMMM...
Rather than bite into it....I spit it out....
here's the kicker...
what is it?????
A ROUND, HALF DIGESTED, KIBBLE OF PIG FEED!!!!!
UUUUUGGGGHHH!
Needless to say, although I still eat from here.... My frequency has dropped by about 95%.
Like I said.... cool, funny, or useful...
There's no vote option for "omfing disgusting", "holy good gawd", or a quick link to SF Dept. of Health yet....
author: Barry A.

description:
ok i changed my mind.  instead of 3.5, i think it deserves a 4.

the curry beef chow fun is everything that you dream of when you think "curry beef chow fun".  the chiu chow dinner menu A is quite good and VERY reasonably priced.  

frankly everything here is reasonably priced.  and quick.  good "home cooking" for ABC's
author: Jason J.

description: I'm being generous with the 4 stars, really its a hole in the wall.  But guess what?  They also serve you food for less than $5.99 a box and tasty, that the head chef cooks readily on the spot.  You can watch him cook your food after you order and the food has never failed to satisfy my hunger like Mongolian Beef rice, Dry Fried Beef Noodles, and Fried Fish with corn.  I would much rather eat here than at a fast food joint or panda express, its much healthier and authentic.  Oh and for $3.00 you can even get wonton noodles.  Can't beat that.  I come here not expecting a fancy meal, but homey unpretentious cooking.
author: Peachie Y.

description: I really want to love this place since it has that special hole in the wall appeal, cheap prices and some more unusual dishes.  Chiu Chow style is similar to Cantonese.  I've eaten here several times (because they serve congee) and I've never had anything that made me think this is really good...or really bad.  It's on the bland side.  I don't mind non-spicy, light dishes.  If they are fresh and light, I actually really like them - but this place doesn't come across as having fresh and light dishes.
author: Lolia S.

description: I was craving wonton.  I drove past a couple places in the sunset with no luck in parking.  I always drove past Menkee Wonton but never went.  Now there was parking, so it's fate.  Walked in at 11:30 on a Sunday, it was empty.  Ordered togo, and it took 5 minutes.  $2.88, out the door.  You get what you pay for.  Only about 4 wonton, but alot of noodles.  It was filling, cheap, but I might need to go find more wonton now.
author: Jonathan W.

description: Cheap wonton mein for $3.10 if you do take out! 6-8 giant won ton balls and lots of noodles. Good for a snack or a cold night and a movie at home.
author: Jason C. J.

description: My favorite "hole in the wall" chinese food place!!! "Wok Hay" is incredible. I go there 2-3 times a month. 10% on Take-Out!!! Not the cleanest looking place, but the food it spot on! Fried Silver Fish is great, Deep Fried Tofu is closest to old Chinatown!
author: Terry O.

description: This is a great place for take out because the prices are on the inexpensive side  which I appreciate. Plus it close to where I live another plus. Just for those reason I give it 4 stars. The food here is not bad and service decent. My order came pretty quick(tomatoe beef chow mein, crispy noodles style)  and I have to say it would of cost more at other places. The portions are on the generous side too. Have to come here more often.
author: Leon C.

description:
I've always been curious about Menkee Wonton, with it's "10% off to go order" banner and it's stack of cardboard boxes in the entryway, it had some hole in the wall potential. After walking up and down  Noriega in the drizzle I decided that a bowl of wontons was needed. 
The small dining room is surprisingly tidier and more pleasant than the entrance lets on. I went for the take out option and the order taker lady was pretty friendly. Duck wonton soup to go, $4.83 including tax and the discount, was a decent 3 star bowl. It was difficult to opt for Menkee when my favorite wontons were down the street, but I had to satisfy the curiosity. Lightly flavored broth slightly enhanced with msg, held a flotilla of small, brussel sprout sized wontons. The skins were the appropriate thinness without any doughy bits. The ground pork and chopped shrimp filling was serviceable, but nothing to write home about. A sprinkling of chopped scallions and some cabbage added balance. 
Menkee's strength is their low prices and varied menu. Run, don't walk, down there to get on the special of dried pig skin and pig blood with chives for $3.25/lb. Seriously though, I'll probably drop in from time to time to grab a rice plate ($4-5) or something new (to me) off their Chiuchow style special snack menu. This one's on the 2.5-3 star border.
author: Candice L.

description: Though I've frequented Menkee often through the years, living a block away, I think their mediocre food and what they think of as  "customer service" has finally taken its toll.  On a recent visit, having placed a phone order for a chow mein dish, was given a rice plate.  On returning and pointing out the error - on the menu -  was then given a soup dish.  They'd basically swapped the ingredients from the original order and attempted to pass it off as my intended order.  The waitress was firm in trying to convince me fried noodles are served in a broth....well, I didn't create a scene, but there are far too many such restaurants on Noriega.   It's inexpensive, but little more.
author: Craig G.

description: The place isn't all that clean and it looks like they've just moved in - but it has always looked that way. The food is pretty good, the wonton soup is digestible and I find myself being very fond of the Oyster cake and the cuisine's seriously better than the place looks.
author: Roger W.

description: Cheap good grub! Best sweet and sour pork I've had. They make it crunchy not soggie like other places. Usually eat here when I'm doing my laundry.
author: Spooky B.

description: Used to come here with Lily L for the cheap won ton in high school. Just went again for won ton recently and I remember it being more satisfying.  I guess you pay for what you get. Cheap chinese food, especially if you get it to go (10% off). Another plus is that takeout is cooked really quickly, almost right after I finished paying for my order, it was done and ready for me to take home. Which was good cause I was starving.
author: Tiff L.

description:
This place went down hill ever since the new owners took over maybe 1.5 or 2 years ago.  This used to be one of my favorite places to go to growing up.  Food used to be cheap, fast, and good.

Now, the food portion is so small that I don't get full with an order of chow fun or chow mein where before I can barely finish it for lunch.  Everything else shrank drastically as well.  The only good thing is the price is still the same (very cheap).  The quality and the freshness of the food is below average.  The new owner IS the chef.  The food does not taste nearly as good as it used to be either.  His daughter and his son are the waiter and waitresses.  The wife helps in the kitchen but does not cook at all.  There is only one chef which leads to my next complaint.  During peak hours, it takes FOREVER to get your food.  I suspect the son leaves the phone off the hook on purpose during peak times so they can catch up with orders.  There were several times I tried to call and would get busy signals for an hour.  One time they were telling me it's an hour wait to get my order as they are all queued up.  What a joke!  I can also hear the husband and the wife yell at the helper sometimes, which is rude and unprofessional in front of customers.  I stopped going to this place altogether.  I miss the old owner.
author: Jon J.

description:
Ok, so dining in is not such a great idea.. there's bugs flying around and it just looks run down.. so, to make your dinner more appetizing, you order out and eat it at home.. 
my boyfriend loves this place for the obscure stuff they have, like pigs blood and other 'tasty' (ew) stuff.. i tend to stay away from those things.. but one thing, I really like is there spicy salted silver fish.. they're these silver fish breaded in some kind of breading and salted, with garlic and a little kick of pepper. it kind of gets taking used to.. eating the whole fish, eyes and all.. but once you don't think about the eyeballs you're crunching in your mouth, it's the best thing they have here. you sprinkle some over rice and dinner is totally served! yum yum.
author: Mari K.

description: your typical asian restaurant, you can't beat the price and good food which get your full... looks kinda ghetto but doesn't judge the outside... only ate here once and i love it!
author: JessePanda C.

description: This place is pretty DIRT CHEAP, but it's definitely not dirty -- it's just not well decorated like other fancy looking places. If you're the type that's looking for a romantic/fancy atmostphere, this is the wrong place to be. If you're looking for a good and cheap dinner, this is it!
author: Faye H.

description: you're pretty much going here because it's dirt cheap, decent, and fast.  good place to order rice plates to go.  whatever standard rice plate you want, they can make, even if it's off menu.  this place isn't winning any cleanliness awards.
author: J M.

description: the runny eggs over rice with chicken is really good! and so are the won tons. really cheap, around 4-5 dollars!
author: christy w.

description: i am usually satisfied w/ what i order here. i think their salty fish fried rice (it sounds nasty, but its really good) always has a lot of flavor and their fried stuffed tofu is a must! their wonton and noodle soups and their tomato beef chow mein is also pretty good. just your typical hole in the wall chinese restaurant that serves some good chinese food. my friend and i just stuffed our faces w/ 3 dishes for $16 - cheap enough to go get dessert right after!
author: Douglas F.

description: Inexpensive, quick, and great portions!  I always order take out from this place and they always have it ready within 5 minutes. What more can I ask for!
author: Jason S.
